title: Question 93: What is righteousness?
question: What is righteousness?
answer: It is God’s viewing sinners as good, not for their own works, but for what Christ has done for them.

title: Question 94: Can anyone be saved by his own righteousness?
question: Can anyone be saved by his own righteousness?
answer: No. No one is good enough for God.

title: Question 95: What is adoption?
question: What is adoption?
answer: It is God’s making sinners into his children by grace.

title: Question 96: What is sanctification?
question: What is sanctification?
answer: It is God’s making sinners holy in heart and conduct.

title: Question 97: Is this change in all who are saved?
question: Is this change in all who are saved?
answer: Yes. All who are truly saved are changed by the Holy Spirit.

title: Question 98: What is repentance unto life?
question: What is repentance unto life?
answer: It is a saving grace, worked in the heart by the Holy Spirit, causing a sinner to turn from sin to God.

title: Question 99: What is faith in Jesus Christ?
question: What is faith in Jesus Christ?
answer: Faith in Jesus Christ is a saving grace, worked in the heart by the Holy Spirit, causing a sinner to receive and rest on Christ alone for salvation.

title: Question 100: Can you repent and believe in Christ by your own power?
question: Can you repent and believe in Christ by your own power?
answer: No. I can do nothing good without God’s Holy Spirit.

title: Question 101: How does the Holy Spirit baptize believers?
question: How does the Holy Spirit baptize believers?
answer: The Holy Spirit puts believers into the body of Christ by a spiritual union.

title: Question 102: How do you receive the Holy Spirit?
question: How do you receive the Holy Spirit?
answer: I must repent of my sins and believe in Christ.

title: Question 103: How long does the Holy Spirit stay with believers?
question: How long does the Holy Spirit stay with believers?
answer: The Holy Spirit dwells in believers forever.

title: Question 104: What does the Holy Spirit do for believers?
question: What does the Holy Spirit do for believers?
answer: The Holy Spirit teaches, comforts, and helps believers to pray and to understand God’s Word.

title: Question 105: What will become of the righteous?
question: What will become of the righteous?
answer: At death, the righteous will be taken to be with Christ, and at the last day will be raised in glory and made perfectly blessed in the full enjoyment of God forever.

title: Question 106: What will become of the wicked?
question: What will become of the wicked?
answer: At death, the wicked will be cast into hell, and at the last day will be raised to endure the wrath of God forever.

title: Question 107: What is prayer?
question: What is prayer?
answer: Prayer is talking with God.

title: Question 108: In whose name should we pray?
question: In whose name should we pray?
answer: Only in the name of Christ.

title: Question 109: What has Christ given to teach us how to pray?
question: What has Christ given to teach us how to pray?
answer: The Lord’s Prayer.

title: Question 110: Can you repeat the Lord’s Prayer?
question: Can you repeat the Lord’s Prayer?
answer: Our Father in heaven, hallowed be your name. Your kingdom come, your will be done, on earth as it is in heaven. Give us this day our daily bread, and forgive us our debts, as we also have forgiven our debtors. And lead us not into temptation, but deliver us from evil. For yours is the kingdom and the power and the glory, forever. Amen.

title: Question 111: How many petitions are there in the Lord’s Prayer?
question: How many petitions are there in the Lord’s Prayer?
answer: Six.

title: Question 112: What is the first petition?
question: What is the first petition?
answer: Hallowed be your name.

title: Question 113: What do we pray for in the first petition?
question: What do we pray for in the first petition?
answer: That God’s name may be honored by us and all men.

title: Question 114: What is the second petition?
question: What is the second petition?
answer: Your kingdom come.

title: Question 115: What do we pray for in the second petition?
question: What do we pray for in the second petition?
answer: That the gospel may be preached in all the world, and believed and obeyed by us and all men.

title: Question 116: What is the third petition?
question: What is the third petition?
answer: Your will be done, on earth as it is in heaven.

title: Question 117: What do we pray for in the third petition?
question: What do we pray for in the third petition?
answer: That men on earth may serve God as the angels do in heaven.
